alert.note: Alert for Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range; Upper Gila River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 1:19PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Grant County through 145 PM MDT... At 118 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Pinos Altos, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cherry Creek Campground, McMillan Campground and Portions of the Gila Wilderness. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range; Upper Gila River Valley
